title.rendered: 9 Best Adobe Photoshop CC Courses for Beginners to Take in 2023

content.rendered:
Adobe Photoshop is ubiquitous and has become synonymous with graphic design. Even if you have never used Photoshop before, you probably have seen extraordinary digital art made with it. Reality is, this program is way more powerful than it used to be and it can be used not only for photography and web design but also for a variety of digital art forms, animated GIF, illustration, and much more.

Although, trying to find the best online course for learning Adobe Photoshop can be overwhelming with so many options; we have 1,100+ Adobe Photoshop courses on Class Central. Therefore, after 6 hours of research, I’ve created this guide with the best Adobe Photoshop CC online courses and tutorials, and ranked them using a well-defined methodology. If you are on a budget, 3 courses are completely free!

Course Workload In Brief
1. Photoshop for Beginners (Envato Tuts+) 3-4 hours Best for the time constrained to learn the essentials for free
2. Adobe Photoshop CC: Your Complete Beginner to Advanced Class (Udemy) 16 hours From essential to pro-level techniques with practical projects
3. Master Photoshop in 30 Days (PHLEARN) 7 hours 30 days challenge to learn photoshop with custom material
4. Photoshop 2021 Essential Training: The Basics (LinkedIn Learning) 6-7 hours Learn the basics for design or photography
5. Introducción a Adobe Photoshop (Domestika) 7 hours Learn and master Photoshop from scratch in Spanish
6. Ultimate Adobe Photoshop Training: From Beginner to Pro 2022 (Udemy) 15 hours Very practical and easy to follow course to get you started
7. Adobe Photoshop for Beginners (Domestika) 6-7 hours Learn from the basics to creating an animated GIF
8. Photoshop 2022 MasterClass (Udemy) 14 hours Create the perfect workflow and learn how professionals do it
9. Adobe Photoshop Mega Course-From Beginner to Super Designer (Udemy) 18 hours Fast paced and comprehensive covers basics and advanced techniques

What is Adobe Photoshop?

Photoshop is Adobe’s graphics editor for Windows and macOS. It’s the second most used graphic design software with 28% of market share, behind Adobe Illustrator with 42%. It’s quite impressive how it’s still so relevant after over 30 years in the market!

Besides being so popular among photo editing enthusiasts and professionals, Photoshop has become an important tool for digital artists and web designers as well, being fully integrated with the drawing tablets it makes the perfect combo from start to finish of any composition.

You can purchase Adobe Photoshop as a standalone app for a monthly subscription of about $10, or all Adobe apps for about $55 (20+ Creative Cloud apps, including XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, and After Effects) with a 7 day free trial. Adobe also offers a 50% discount for students and teachers.

Best Courses Guides Methodology

I built this ranking following the now tried-and-tested methodology used in previous Best Courses Guides (you can find them all here). It involves a three-step process:

  1. Research: I started by leveraging Class Central’s database with 70K+ online courses and 170K reviews. Then, I made a preliminary selection of 1,100+ Adobe Photoshop courses by rating, reviews, and bookmarks.
  2. Evaluate: I read through reviews on Class Central, Reddit, and course providers to understand what other learners thought about each course and combined it with my own experience as a learner.
  3. Select: Well-made courses were picked if they presented valuable and engaging content and they have to fit in a set of criteria and be ranked accordingly: comprehensive curriculum, selling price, release date, ratings and enrollments.

Course Ranking Statistics

Here are some aggregate stats about the ranking:

  • 3 courses are Free and 6 are Paid.
  • 8 courses are in English, and 1 in Spanish with English subtitles.
  • Together, they account for 1,013,717 enrollments and over 10 million YouTube views.
  • The most featured provider is Udemy with 4 courses.

1. Photoshop for Beginners (Envato Tuts+)

My #1 pick for the best Adobe Photoshop CC course is Photoshop for Beginners with Daniel Walter Scott.

This free tutorial equips you with the skills needed to get started with the essentials of Photoshop starting from scratch and working quickly into more exciting techniques. Learn how to use layers, change color levels, how to retouch and manipulate images with real world practical examples. This course is for photographers, marketers, and designers and it doesn’t require any previous Photoshop knowledge.

Hello Dan, I wanted to let you know that in 3 hours you have taught me more about Photoshop than I learned at my 4-year design school. Thank you so much for this tutorial! – Zoe A, learner

What You’ll Learn

Some topics covered in this course: How Photoshop Layers Work, Combining Multiple Images, Tone Adjustment With Levels, Color and Hue Adjustment, How to Work With Type, Layer Styles and Effects, How to Crop, Resizing and Resolution, Rectangle and Elliptical Marquee Tool, Clipping Masks, Quick Selection Tool, Select and Mask, Smart Objects, Healing Brush, Content-Aware Scale, Exporting Images, and more.

How You’ll Learn

In this tutorial is divided into 23 parts, you will learn by following along with the instructor using the provided downloadable resources and trying each technique by yourself, so it’s recommended you already have Adobe Photoshop CC installed in your computer to make the best of it.

Institution Envato Tuts+
Provider YouTube
Instructor(s) Daniel Walter Scott
Level Beginner
Workload 3-4 hours
Enrollments Nearly 10 million views
Rating 196,000 thumbs up
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • Envato Tuts+ has 3 other free courses on Adobe Photoshop: Advanced Photoshop for Everyone, Typography Poster Design in Adobe Photoshop, and Photoshop Retouching for Beginners.
  • Daniel Walter Scott is a best seller course instructor on Udemy who is also an Adobe Certified Instructor. Check some of his courses:
    • Adobe Photoshop CC – Essentials Training Course on Udemy or Skillshare.
    • Adobe Photoshop CC – Advanced Training Course on Udemy or Skillshare.
    • Photoshop CC 2020 Productivity Techniques on Skillshare.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

2. Adobe Photoshop CC: Your Complete Beginner to Advanced Class (Udemy)

My #2 pick is for Adobe Photoshop CC: Your Complete Beginner to Advanced Class with Phil Ebiner.

This course will guide you from the essential to pro-level techniques to equip you with the necessary tools to become an effective Photoshop user with practical projects. By the end of this course, you will be able to comfortably navigate Photoshop, edit and retouch photos, use blending mode and layer styles, select and edit just parts of your image, shape and pen tool, add and edit text, and much more.

This course is great for beginners who have used Photoshop or intermediate/casual users who want to learn new techniques and tools.

I really enjoyed this in-depth course, going from the basics to more advanced techniques. It was great having all the resources provided for following along and doing the projects as the course progressed – I always find I learn more and retain the knowledge by doing, rather than just listening to a lecture, and this course is very well structured to make sure the skills learnt are relevant and practical. – John B., learner

What You’ll Learn

This course will cover everything you need to know to start, including:

  • Getting started with Photoshop
  • Navigating and customizing  the workspace
  • Using the Photoshop layers panel
  • Editing RAW and non-RAW photos in Photoshop
  • Using selection tools
  • Using tools like dodge and burn to edit just part of your images
  • Retouching photos such as whitening teeth, removing blemishes, and more
  • Creating and adjusting shapes in Photoshop
  • Designing graphics with different blend modes
  • Adding and editing layer styles like bevels and drop shadows
  • Adding artistic filters like blurs
  • Adding and editing text to your graphics
  • Saving your projects for anything – printing, online, and more

How You’ll Learn

This course is divided into 19 modules and 178 bite-sized lectures. You can learn by following along with the instructor using the course workbook and project files. By the end of each module, you will be invited to work on a project, in total there are 9 class projects to work on your own.

Provider Udemy
Instructor(s) Phil Ebiner and Video School
Level Beginner
Workload 16 hours
Enrollments 508,948
Rating 4.7 (19,827 ratings)
Certificate Available

Fun Facts

  • Phil Ebiner has 2 other courses available via Skillshare: Adobe Photoshop CC for Beginners and Adobe Photoshop CC: The Complete Beginner Course.
  • Phil Ebiner is a top-rated Udemy instructor with 2+ Million students.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

3. Master Photoshop in 30 Days (PHLEARN)

My #3 pick is for Master Photoshop in 30 Days by PHLEARN.

In this free course, you will take you from a complete beginner all the way to the point where you know how to retouch, do a composite, edit raw photos, remove objects, and work with text and graphics in 30 days. If you want, you can sign up for the course calendar and receive a custom pdf by email.

These videos are great, they are easy to follow along with and highly informative without moving too fast. They took me from 0 understanding of photoshop to a fantastic core foundation that will allow me to better understand and build more complex skills. I am excited to learn more from your channel! – Blake Leverence, learner

What You’ll Learn

In the first 10 days you will learn how to navigate Photoshop by opening, editing and saving files, how to use layers and masks, create selections, levels and curves, change any color with hue and saturation, transform tool and brush, and end this first part with crop and resize.

From day 11 to 20, you will learn how to add text, use liquify tool, edit non-destructively with Smart Objects, use blending modes, remove distractions, dodge and burn, create a photo collage, edit RAW, and color grade a photo.

In the last 10 days, you will learn how to change color, correct exposure, remove blemishes, use frequency retouching, sharpen a portrait, cut out a subject and hair with Pen tool, match light and color for composites, edit landscapes in camera RAW, and finally, swap a sky in a landscape.

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided in 30 parts, you can follow along with the instructor and use the provided calendar (after signing up), or you can watch the course at your own pace. Either way, always try and experiment with the tool by yourself.

Institution PHLEARN
Provider YouTube
Instructor(s) Aaron Nace
Level Beginner
Workload 7 hours
Enrollments 517,756 views
Rating 11K thumbs up
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • PHLEARN is a YouTube channel dedicated to Photoshop content with over 2 million subscribers.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

4. Photoshop 2021 Essential Training: The Basics (LinkedIn Learning)

My #4 pick is for Photoshop 2021 Essential Training: The Basics with Julieanne Kost, principal evangelist at Adobe Systems.

This course will equip you with the necessary tools to work with the basics of Photoshop for design or photography.

I have tried many Photoshop courses for beginners and this is by far the best one and the only one that I have stuck with to learn Photoshop. I will be looking for more courses with the same instructor. – Marque Todd, learner.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, Julieanne Kost helps you get up to speed with Photoshop 2021, filtering out the noise and complexity to help you quickly achieve the results you want. Julieanne walks through the fundamentals of digital imaging—from working with multiple images to customizing the Photoshop interface. She explains how to choose the right tools to crop, tone, and retouch photos, while always maintaining the highest-quality output. She also demonstrates the most efficient ways to perform common tasks, including working with layers, selections, and masking. Along the way, she shares the secrets of nondestructive editing using Smart Objects, and helps you master features such as adjustment layers, blend modes, filters, type, layer styles, and much more.

Topics covered include: Opening Files, Documents and Navigation, Customizing the Photoshop Interface, Digital Image, Cropping, Straightening, and Adjusting Canvas Size, Layers, Color and Brush, Making Selections, Local Pixel Editing and Retouching, Blend Mode, Smart Object, Transformations, Adjustment Layer, Filters, Shape Layers, Layer Styles, and Type.

How You’ll Learn

In this course divided into 18 modules and 74 videos, you will learn by following along with the instructor and using the provided course materials (zip file of 1.32GB). Each module ends with a quiz to test your knowledge and upon completion of all videos and activities you will receive a certificate to upload to your profile.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor(s) Julieanne Kost
Level Beginner
Workload 6-7 hours
Enrollments 79,646
Rating 4.8 (1.601 ratings)
Certificate Available

Fun Facts

  • Julieanne Kost has worked for Adobe for the last 30 years and has over 8 years of experience as a Photoshop and Lightroom instructor.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

5. Introducción a Adobe Photoshop (Domestika)

My #5 pick is for Introducción a Adobe Photoshop with Carles Marsal, visual artist.

In this series courses in Spanish (with English subtitles), learn and master Photoshop from scratch. Even if you are a complete beginner, you will learn everything you need to know to become a design or digital publishing professional.

This course is for anyone interested in getting started with Photoshop and no prior knowledge is necessary.

I bought each course from him because I want to learn all the way to photo manipulation. I thought it was better to learn from a teacher. I was not disappointed. I already have some experience using Photoshop, he has shown that it is always possible to learn something new, to do something different, more efficiently. I am absolutely satisfied. I sincerely recommend this course. – Csaba Deli, learner

What You’ll Learn

You’ll start by getting to know Adobe Photoshop’s interface and its main tools. You’ll learn to manage and combine documents, work with layers and selections. Plus, another thing that’s essential for this type of project: masks.

Then you’ll dive into the world of photomontage and learn image size and resolution fundamentals. Also, you’ll learn to use transformations so that you can portray anything that you set your mind to.

Later, you’ll discover the vast world of options that Photoshop brushes offer.

You’ll also learn how to use the retouching tools to reconstruct, clean up and improve your photographs and images with an impeccable and realistic finish.

Finally, Carles will explain how to properly apply adjustment layers. Using these, you can do a detailed light and shadow treatment and adjust the color to your project’s needs.

How You’ll Learn

This course is divided into 5 courses and 50 lessons. You will learn by watching the instructions provided and using the 46 provided files. Each course ends with an activity to put into practice what you’ve learned. Upon completion you will receive a certificate of completion.

Provider Domestika
Instructor(s) Carles Marsal
Level Beginner
Workload 7 hours
Enrollments 295,807
Rating 100% positive (8,600 reviews)
Certificate Available

Fun Facts

  • Carles Marsal is a visual artist and art director who lives and works in Barcelona, Spain.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

6. Ultimate Adobe Photoshop Training: From Beginner to Pro 2022 (Udemy)

My sixth pick is for Ultimate Adobe Photoshop Training: From Beginner to Pro 2022 with Cristian Doru Barin, certified Photoshop instructor.

This very practical and easy-to-follow course will equip you with the necessary tools to get started with Photoshop, especially designed for real beginners.

It was a really great, easy to follow course, I learned so much and Photoshop isn’t so intimidating anymore! I really recommend this course to anyone who wants to design/edit with this app, you will feel like an expert after you finish! – Boglárka S., learner

What You’ll Learn

  • How to design icons, business cards, illustrations, and characters.
  • Use creative effects to design stunning text styles
  • Cut away a person from their background
  • Clean up face imperfections, improve and repair photos
  • Remove people or objects from photos
  • Master selections, layers, and working with the layers panel

How You’ll Learn

Divided into 18 modules and 194 bite-sized lectures, this course focuses on real world cases with practical examples and projects. It also provides a package with over 300 PSD files to help you get started. Upon completion of this course you will receive a certificate.

Provider Udemy
Instructor(s) Cristian Doru Barin
Level Beginner
Workload 15 hours
Enrollments 150,832
Rating 4.7 (26,251 ratings)
Certificate Available

Fun Facts

  • Chris Barin is a professional web and app designer with nearly 10 years of Photoshop experience. He’s also an Adobe Certified Instructor and Certified Photoshop Expert with over 260k students on Udemy.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

7. Adobe Photoshop for Beginners (Domestika)

My seventh pick is for Adobe Photoshop for Beginners with Harrison Kuykendall, Creative Director & Retoucher.

In this series of courses you will learn tips and tricks for creating impactful digital work. Follow along as the expert teaches you how to become proficient in Photoshop, from the basics to creating an animated GIF.

By the end of this course, you’ll have all the skills and tools you need to transform images, whether you’re retouching portraits, editing beauty and fashion photography, or creating dynamic animations from still images.

Great course, very practical. The fact that each class is short makes it more dynamic and convenient. – samirnahas44, learner

What You’ll Learn

In the first course, get started by building a foundation of the software: navigation and basic tools, drop-down menus for editing images, and more.

For the second course, dive into the basics of color and light: how to adjust and modify the highlights and shadows of your image, including the different techniques for burning.

In the third course, go through the different methods for making selections and masks: learn the main techniques for cutting out elements using tools like Wand and Pen.

In the fourth course, learn the basic concepts of retouching: how to correct imperfections and see how to clean up skin, understand how to keep your retouching look natural and non-destructive, and how to use the Clone Stamp tool and export your retouched image.

For the fifth course, it’s time to focus on retouching still images. Learn the unique challenges and tools used to edit photos and discover Harrison’s secrets for getting the shape and perspective of still images just right.

Wrap up by learning about image sizing and manipulation. Learn to scale, skew, and distort your images with a range of tools. Take a look at two different warping tools and how you can use them to create animated GIFs.

How You’ll Learn

This course is divided into 6 short courses and 46 bite-sized lessons. You will learn by following along with the instructor while doing projects. There are also 48 files to download to help you along the way. By completing the 6 courses you will receive a certificate.

Provider Domestika
Instructor(s) Harrison Kuykendall
Level Beginner
Workload 6-7 hours
Enrollments 2,531 students
Rating 99% positive (68 reviews)
Certificate Available

Fun Facts

  • Harrison Kuykendall is a New York based creative director and retoucher, founder of the creative agency and post-production house HE-Studios.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

8. Photoshop 2022 MasterClass (Udemy)

My eighth course is for Photoshop 2022 MasterClass with Martin Perhiniak.

This comprehensive course will guide you through the ins and outs of creating a perfect workflow with Photoshop by using shortcuts, selection techniques, seamlessly combining images together, working with different image file formats, and learn from the beginning the way a professional would use this software. This is a great course for beginners or self-taught users wanting to up their skills and refine their workflow to get into the creative industry.

GREAT COURSE! It pretty much covered all the essential tools, techniques and backward compatibility. Also, the great thing is, there are video updates on the latest version of Photoshop and the upgrades. And the opportunity of getting Certified is another great way to level up. You can never find this kind of course that gives away everything. Thank you so much Martin. – Julius M., learner

What You’ll Learn

  • First, we will start with the basics of Photoshop: interface, navigation, preferences, setting up new documents and applying simple adjustments to images.
  • Then, we move on to working with layers, drawing tools and techniques (focusing on Brushes and Vector Shapes).
  • How to work non-destructively in Photoshop: Transformations, Selections, Masking, Smart Objects and Adjustment Layers.
  • Retouching techniques: the difference between technical and creative image retouching and all the features and techniques professionals use for enhancing images for adverts, movie posters and the beauty industry.
  • The different types of image files, the pros and cons of each of them and how to work with the robust Adobe Camera RAW editor.
  • How to work with type in Photoshop.
  • How to save and export your work and learn more advanced Photoshop workflows including 3D Layers, the Timeline panel, Lightroom integration and so much more.

How You’ll Learn

This course is divided into 20 modules and 117 bite-sized lectures. You will learn by following the instructor with real life examples and projects. Each module ends with a quiz to test your knowledge and there are 6 downloadable resources. By completing this course you will receive a certificate.

Provider Udemy
Instructor(s) Martin Perhiniak
Level Beginner
Workload 14 hours
Enrollments 55,980
Rating 4.6 (10,123 ratings)
Certificate Available

Fun Facts

  • Martin is a graphic designer and an Adobe Certified Instructor with over 198k students on Udemy. As a designer and illustrator, he worked for companies like Pixar, BBC, Mattel and as an instructor taught teams at Google, Ben&Jerry’s, House of Lords and Oxford University Press.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

9. Adobe Photoshop Mega Course-From Beginner to Super Designer (Udemy)

My ninth pick is for Adobe Photoshop Mega Course – From Beginner to Super Designer with Alan Ayoubi, graphic designer.

This is a fast paced and comprehensive course that starts from the basics and also covers advanced techniques. This is a great course for beginners who might already be familiar with Photoshop or similar editing software.

This course is loaded with knowledge and exercises that enhance my skills. I have taken other Photoshop courses, but this one helps you tap into your creativity. You learn so much beyond how to use the tools. The sections after the web page design were what I needed to improve my skills. – Michael B., learner

What You’ll Learn

This course is divided into two main sections: Basics and Advanced.

In the first section, you will learn how to remove background from the most complex compositions like curly hair, how to remove objects from a scene, how to change and adjust the colors and make your own color looks. For photographers, you are going to master Camera Raw Filter which is an alternative to Adobe Lightroom. You will learn how to work with text and use it for beautiful Artworks, work with 3D, and make beautiful looks using layer styles.

In the second part, you will learn photomontage and creative artwork, how to achieve a double exposure effect, photo collage for creating outstanding posters, UI designs for mobile and web dashboard, mockups, retouching eyes and skin, abstract gradient, glowing objects, contrast trendy style, and much more.

How You’ll Learn

This course is divided into 23 modules and 154 lectures. You will learn by following the instructor with projects. Each module ends with a homework to put into practice what you’ve learned. There are 33 downloadable resources available. By completing this course you will receive a certificate.

Provider Udemy
Instructor(s) Alan Ayoubi
Level Beginner/Intermediate
Workload 18 hours
Enrollments 50,116
Rating 4.6 (1,352 ratings)
Certificate Available

Fun Facts

  • Alan Ayoubi is a graphic designer and photographer with 11 years of experience. He has accrued over 140k students on Udemy

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.
